strings.string: Početna pozicija:
Uvod korak po korak
1. Napravi novi program
Dodirni "Novi".
Unesi ime programa, odaberi "Započni novi program" i pritisni "Uredu".
2. Kreiraj novi objekt
Pritisni:
Izaberi izvor za početni izgled svog novog objekta.
Nacrtaj novi izgled.
Izaberi iz galerije.
Slikaj.
Unesi ime objekta i pritisni "Uredu" za kreiranje novog objekta.
3. Počni sa kretanjem
Pritisni:
Prvi blok koji koristimo pripada kategoriji "Kretanje".
Choose the "Glide" brick. The object will move to the new position defined with the brick on the stage.
Tap “Play” to go to the stage and see the object gliding.
Use the Android Back Button to get back from the stage.
The brick is now floating. To paste it, move the brick to the desired position. You can also move already inserted bricks by tapping the brick until it is floating again.
4. Promeni izgled
Možeš promeniti izgled svog objekta.
Choose the “Switch to look” brick. With this brick you can choose a look or create a new one.
Snap the brick underneath the "Glide" - brick.
Tap into the dropdown field to create a new look.
Choose the source of the image like before.
Now you have to select the new image.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
5. Speak
Now you will find out how to make an object talk.
Choose the “Speak” brick. The object speaks the text, when this brick is executed.
Snap the brick underneath the "Switch to look" brick.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
6. Again and again
This step shows you how to repeat behaviour of objects.
Choose the “Forever” brick. Everything in the loop repeats forever.
Snap the “Forever” brick underneath the "When program started" - brick.
Add another “Glide” brick.
Snap the “Glide” brick aboth the “End of loop” brick.
Tap into the text field of the x and y value and set to 0.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
7. Tapping is everything.
You can also control the behaviour of the object when the program is running on the stage.
Choose the “When tapped” brick. Every brick underneath the “When tapped” will be executed one time when you tap the object on the stage.
Place the “When tapped” underneath the other bricks.
Choose the “Turn right” brick and snap it underneath the “When tapped” brick.
Now you have this script.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage. If you now tap on the object, it spins.
8. Copy, delete or edit a brick
Single tap on the left side of each brick opens the context menu. There you can move, copy, delete or edit the values of the brick with the formula editor.
9. Navigation in the app
Use the Android Back Button to navigate in the app.

Go back one screen to the overview of your object. Here you can go into the scripts and also to an powerful representation of the looks and sounds of the object. There you can rename, copy add or delete looks and sounds.
Use again the Android Back Button to get to the overview of your objects and your background.
10. Change the background
This is the overview of your objects and the background depends to one program.
The background is like an object, but you just can have on background.
You can add scripts, sounds and look in the same way to the background object.
11. Main Menu
Use the Android Back Button to get to this screen.
Continue with your currently opened program.
Add a new program.
See all your local programs.
Go to the help site and discuss with other users.
Explore the world of the Pocket Code programs. Download and remix programs you like.
Upload the program that is currently opened.
